scale by mean of group mean for imbalanced data

Source: R/scale_mgm.R
scale_mgm.Rd

scale by mean of group mean for imbalanced data

scale_mgm(expr, label, pooled.sd = FALSE)

Arguments

expr

matrix

label

a vector of group label

pooled.sd

logical, if to use pooled SD for scaling

Value

scaled matrix

Details

$$z=\frac{x-\frac{\sum_k^{n_D}(\mu_k)}{n_D}}{s}$$ where \(\mu_k\) is the mean of x in \(k^{th}\) class, and \(n_D\) is the number of classes, \(s\) is the standard deviation of x, when pooled.sd is set to be TRUE, \(s\) will be replaced with \(s_{pooled}\), \(s_{pooled}=\sqrt{\frac{\sum_k^{n_D}{(n_k-1){s_k}^2}}{\sum_k^{n_D}{n_k}-k}}\)

Examples

scale_mgm(matrix(rnorm(100), 10), label = rep(letters[1:2], 5))
#>             [,1]        [,2]        [,3]        [,4]       [,5]        [,6]
#>  [1,]  1.3663405 -0.48931977 -1.85236500 -0.76886172  0.3519732  0.34014600
